00129 /*==============================================================================
00130  *
00131  * Function:
00132  *      nfs4_op_lookupp - The NFS4_OP_LOOKUPP operation
00133  *
00134  * Synopsis:
00135  *   int nfs4_op_lookupp(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00136  *                         compound_data_t   * data,
00137  *                         struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00138  *
00139  * Description:
00140  *      This functions handles the NFS4_OP_LOOKUPP operation in NFSv4. This function can be called only from nfs4_Compound
00141  *
00142  * Other Inputs:
00143  *
00144  * Outputs:
00145  *
00146   * Interfaces:
00147  *
00148  * Resources Used:
00149  *      memory
00150  *
00151  * Limitations:
00152  *
00153  * Assumptions:
00154  *  Notes:
00155  *
00156  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00157 
00158 
00171 #define arg_LOOKUPP4 op->nfs_argop4_u.oplookupp
00172 #define res_LOOKUPP4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplookupp
00173 
00174 int nfs4_op_lookupp(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00175                       compound_data_t   * data,
00176                       struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00177 {
00178   fsal_name_t            name ;
00179   cache_entry_t        * dir_pentry = NULL ;
00180   cache_entry_t        * file_pentry = NULL ;
00181   fsal_attrib_list_t     attrlookup ;
00182   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status ;
00183   int                    error = 0 ;
00184   fsal_handle_t        * pfsal_handle = NULL ;
00185 
00186   char                   __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_op_lookupp" ;
00187 
00188   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_LOOKUPP ;
00189   resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplookupp.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
00190 
00191   /* If there is no FH */
00192   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00193     {
00194       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00195       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00196     }
00197   
00198   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00199   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00200     {
00201       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00202       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00203      }
00204   
00205   /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00206   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00207     {
00208       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00209       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00210     }
00211 
00212   /* looking up for parent directory from ROOTFH return NFS4ERR_NOENT (RFC3530, page 166) */
00213   if( data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len == data->rootFH.nfs_fh4_len && memcmp( data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val, data->rootFH.nfs_fh4_val, data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ) == 0 )
00214     {
00215       /* Nothing to do, just reply with success */
00216       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_NOENT ;
00217       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00218   }
00219 
00220   /* If in pseudoFS, proceed with pseudoFS specific functions */
00221   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00222     return nfs4_op_lookupp_pseudo( op, data, resp ) ;
00223 
00224   /* If Filehandle points to a xattr object, manage it via the xattrs specific functions */
00225   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Xattr( &(data->currentFH ) ) ) 
00226     return nfs4_op_lookupp_xattr( op, data, resp ) ;
00227   
00228   /* If data->exportp is null, a junction from pseudo fs was traversed, credp and exportp have to be updated */
00229   if( data->pexport == NULL )
00230     {
00231       if( ( error = nfs4_SetCompoundExport( data ) ) != NFS4_OK )
00232         {
00233           res_LOOKUPP4.status = error ;
00234           return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00235         }
00236     }
00237 
00238   /* Preparying for cache_inode_lookup ".." */
00239   file_pentry = NULL;
00240   dir_pentry = data->current_entry ;
00241   name = FSAL_DOT_DOT ;
00242   
00243   
00244   /* BUGAZOMEU: Faire la gestion des cross junction traverse */
00245   if( ( file_pentry = cache_inode_lookup( dir_pentry, 
00246                                           &name, 
00247                                           &attrlookup, 
00248                                           data->ht,
00249                                           data->pclient,
00250                                           data->pcontext, 
00251                                           &cache_status ) ) != NULL )
00252     {
00253       /* Extract the fsal attributes from the cache inode pentry */
00254       pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( file_pentry, &cache_status )  ;
00255       if( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00256         {
00257           res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00258           return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00259         }
00260 
00261       /* Convert it to a file handle */
00262       if( !nfs4_FSALToFhandle( &data->currentFH, pfsal_handle, data ) )
00263         {
00264           res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00265           return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
00266         }
00267 
00268       /* Copy this to the mounted on FH (if no junction is traversed */
00269       memcpy( (char *)(data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_val), 
00270               (char *)(data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val), data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ) ;
00271       data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len = data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ;
00272       
00273       /* Keep the pointer within the compound data */
00274       data->current_entry = file_pentry ;
00275       data->current_filetype = file_pentry->internal_md.type ;
00276       
00277       /* Return successfully */ 
00278       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00279       return NFS4_OK ;
00280       
00281     }
00282  
00283    /* If the part of the code is reached, then something wrong occured in the lookup process, status is not HPSS_E_NOERROR 
00284    * and contains the code for the error */
00285   
00286   res_LOOKUPP4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00287 
00288   return res_LOOKUPP4.status;
00289 } /* nfs4_op_lookupp */
00290 
00291 
00302 void nfs4_op_lookupp_Free( LOOKUPP4res * resp )
00303 {
00304   /* Nothing to be done */
00305   return ;
00306 } /* nfs4_op_lookupp_Free */
